intro: Eriospermum bayeri, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in dry environments, with a deep root system that helps it access water from deeper soil layers. Its small, rounded leaves and showy inflorescences make it a distinctive species within its habitat. Eriospermum bayeri is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is considered a rare, endemic species.
